snippet: Fans should recognize the commercial underpinnings of March Madness for what it is: a big business for universities that has little-to-nothing to do with education.
abstract: Editorial, citing news that the starting five players of the University of Kentucky's national championship men's basketball team will jump into the professional draft after only a year or two of college, scores the culture of March Madness and the apparent acquiescence to 'one-and-done' ethos that surrounds it.
lead_paragraph: Fans should recognize the commercial underpinnings of March Madness for what it is: a big business for universities that has little-to-nothing to do with education.

headline.seo: One and Done for Alma Mater
headline.main: One and Done for Alma Mater
headline.print_headline: One and Done for Alma Mater
